trans-unit.source: Binds the value of an HTTP request <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref> field to a parameter object.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> class to bind the value of a form variable in the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.Form%2A> collection to a parameter used in a parameterized query or command.
Controls that bind data to the parameter might throw an exception if a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> is specified but no corresponding form variable is passed.
They might also display no data if the form variable is passed with no corresponding value.
Set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> to avoid these situations where appropriate.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> class provides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.FormField%2A> property, which identifies the name of the form variable to bind to, in addition to those inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> does not validate the value passed by the form element in any way; it uses the raw value.

In most cases you can validate the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> before it is used by a data source control by handling an event, such as the `Selecting`, `Updating`, `Inserting`, or `Deleting` event exposed by the data source control you are using.

If the value of the parameter does not pass your validation tests, you can cancel the data operation by setting the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property of the associated <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs> class to `true`.
Initializes a new unnamed instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter"></xref> class.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.%23ctor%2A> constructor is initialized with default values for all its properties.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.FormField%2A> is initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.

Additionally, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.TypeCode?displayProperty=fullName>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.Input>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is initialized to null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Initializes a new instance of the class with the values of the instance specified by the original parameter.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.%23ctor%2A> constructor is a `protected` copy constructor used to clone a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> instance.

The values of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter>, including <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.FormField%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> are all transferred to the new instance.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter"></xref> instance that the current instance is initialized from.
Initializes a new named instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter"></xref> class, using the specified string to identify which form variable field to bind to.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.%23ctor%2A> constructor is initialized with the specified parameter name and string that identifies the form variable that the parameter binds to.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> properties are initialized with default values.
The name of the parameter.
The name of the form variable that the parameter object is bound to.
The default is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter"></xref> class, using the specified string to identify which form variable field to bind to.
The name of the parameter.
The database type of the parameter.
The name of the form variable that the parameter object is bound to.
Initializes a new named and strongly typed instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter"></xref> class, using the specified string to identify which form variable to bind to.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.%23ctor%2A> constructor is initialized with the specified parameter name, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A>, and string that identifies the form variable that the parameter binds to.
Only the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.ConvertEmptyStringToNull%2A> properties are initialized with default values.
The name of the parameter.
The type that the parameter represents.
The default is <xref href="System.TypeCode.Object"></xref>.
The name of the form variable that the parameter object is bound to.
The default is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Returns a duplicate of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter"></xref> instance.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.Clone%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.%23ctor%2A> copy constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> class with the values of the current instance.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter"></xref> that is an exact duplicate of the current one.
Updates and returns the value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> attempts to bind to the form variable every time the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.Evaluate%2A> method is called.
The `context` parameter is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.Evaluate%2A> method to retrieve the value of the specified form field from the request.
The `control` parameter is ignored.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> of the request.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> that is associated with the page where the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter"></xref> is used.
An object that represents the updated and current value of the parameter.

If the context or the request is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.Evaluate(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Web.UI.Control)"></xref> method returns null.
Gets or sets the name of the form variable that the parameter binds to.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.FormField%2A> identifies a name/value pair that is passed in the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.Form%2A> collection.

While the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.FormField%2A> property identifies the name of the pair, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter> binds to its corresponding value at run time.

If the expected form variable string name/value pair is not passed to the ASP.NET Web page in the collection, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.Evaluate%2A> method binds the parameter to the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property, if it is set.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> is not set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormParameter.Evaluate%2A> method fails to bind the parameter to a value.
A string that identifies the form variable to which the parameter binds.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the client input in the parameter is validated.
`true` if client input is validated; otherwise, `false`.
